page.title: 09SUTTON CHENEY SOCIAL LIFE
page.content:
Again as in most small rural communities the church is the focal point of social activity.
The church in addition to the more orthodox spiritual services, provides, through the auspices of the nearby Church Hall, a catalyst for both the Senior Citizens Club, which meets once every week and the Womens Institute which meets once every month.
The Atherstone Hunt meets at Sutton Cheney twice each year.
The Greyhound and Hercules Inns, by virtue of their use as meeting places, form an integral part of the local communication network.
